entry.title: The Robins: Bruce Wayne Returns
entry.summary:
Author: SpiderFan_33

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 23,346Chapters: 18/18Kudos: 18

Summary: Bruce Wayne is supposed to be dead. For five years, Gotham learned to breathe without him. Dick stepped down. Damian rose. Tim built something like a life in the wreckage. It was messy, hard-won — and finally, finally stable. Now Bruce is back. But the man who returns isn’t the one they buried. He’s sharper. Colder. Watching Gotham like it belongs to him — and watching Tim like he might, too. Every look lingers too long. Every word feels like a test Tim doesn’t remember agreeing to take. Damian Wayne is Batman now. He fought for that mantle, bled for it, rebuilt the city around it. He will not surrender it. He will not surrender Tim. As assassinations mount and the vigilante ban tightens, the line between strategy and seduction starts to blur. Old loyalties fracture. Old instincts resurface. And Damian is forced to confront a question he never wanted to ask: How far will he go to keep what’s his? Because Bruce Wayne didn’t come back to save Gotham. He came back to take it.

entry.title: The Robins: Batman Meets Batwoman
entry.summary:
Author: SpiderFan_33

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,797Chapters: 22/22Kudos: 7

Summary: Years after the death of Bruce Wayne and with Dick Grayson suspended between life and death, Gotham gains a new Batman—and loses its illusions. Damian Wayne takes the cowl without apology: younger, sharper, and unwilling to pretend he is anything but himself. At his side is Tim Drake—partner, husband, and steady presence in a city unraveling under grief, fear, and rumor. Their bond is private, fierce, and unshakable, even as the weight of legacy presses in from all sides. As Alfred is laid to rest and Jason slips out of reach, new figures step into the void. Kate Kane arrives with hard-earned instincts and sharper suspicions. Lincoln March arrives with charm, shared history, and a pull Damian can’t quite ignore—one Kate doesn’t trust for a second. Gotham is watching its future take shape in real time: a Batman who loves deeply, fights decisively, and refuses to be gentle for the sake of comfort. This is a story about grief and devotion, temptation and loyalty, and the dangerous intimacy of letting someone truly see you while the city decides whether you deserve to stand.
